summary: Rename the website/product to Nexus Forge AI and add an on-site AI assistant that answers visitor questions with real, working logic, while maintaining the professional government-grade marketing/explainer site requirements (capabilities, safe testing guidance, demo link, contact details).
architectural_notes: Website should clearly explain app purpose, how it works, and every capability; include guidance for safe testing by companies; include contact email SentinelAI@usa.com and link to https://nexusforgeai.base44.app/Chat.

Adopt 'Option A' government-grade design language: flat/minimal/authoritative styling, hard lines, increased whitespace and hierarchy, muted graphite/off-white palette with subtle green accent; avoid gradients, glows, and overly 'AI-generated' aesthetics.
Ensure the 'Try Demo' section/background uses restrained accent colors (avoid large green fills) to maintain the formal government-grade look and avoid an 'AI-made' aesthetic.
Update site/product name to “Nexus Forge AI” across all pages/metadata/branding.
Add an on-site AI assistant/chat component that answers visitor questions (functional, real logic; production-ready with no runtime errors).
Ensure zero occurrences of the old brand name “SentinelAI” anywhere on the live site/UI/metadata/content; all branding must read “Nexus Forge AI” consistently.
known_issues: Deployment failed during build/deploy step ("Something went wrong with the deployment").
On-site AI assistant widget/UI does not appear on the live site.
AI assistant fails with IC replica rejection (Reject code 5, IC0508) because backend canister 5bwdt-cyaaa-aaaan-q2pka-cai is stopped when calling getAnswer.
Live site still shows “SentinelAI” branding across the page; rename/branding changes to “Nexus Forge AI” did not apply or are incomplete.
Assistant UI reports “Assistant service is not ready” indicating the backend service/health readiness is failing or not correctly detected by the frontend.

Assistant returns a 'couldn't find an answer' fallback for basic questions like “What is Nexus Forge AI?”, indicating the on-canister knowledge base/answering logic is incomplete or not seeded with core product info.

existing_features.title: Create a professional multi-section marketing/explainer website for the AI app that clearly explains what the app does, how it works, and what companies can safely do to test it, using the provided demo URL and positioning the product as suitable for all company types (not only government agencies).

Add a dedicated 'Capabilities' section/page that enumerates and explains every AI capability the product offers in a structured, scannable format (grouped categories with concise descriptions, inputs/outputs, and limitations/constraints where applicable), written for business decision-makers and technical evaluators.

Add a 'How it works' explanation that describes the product workflow end-to-end (how a company tests the AI, what users do in the demo, what happens to inputs/outputs at a high level) without revealing sensitive implementation details; include an explicit 'Safe testing' explanation suitable for compliance-minded organizations.

Implement a Contact section with the provided email address and clear next steps for companies to request access, ask questions, or schedule a demo; include a mailto link and optionally a simple on-site contact form if supported without third-party services.

Ensure overall build quality: no runtime errors, no broken routes, responsive layout, and consistent typography/spacing; include basic SEO metadata (title, description) and accessible semantics (landmarks, heading order, link/button labels).

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a security/professional AI product (avoid blue/purple), including a consistent color palette, typography scale, button styles, and section layouts across the site.

Add a 'Try the Demo' experience on the site that clearly routes users to the provided chat demo URL; include context text describing what testers should try and what to expect, plus a clear disclaimer that the demo is a test environment (if applicable).
Add and render required static marketing images (generated assets) by placing them in frontend/public/assets/generated and using them in the hero and supporting sections (no backend image routing).

Update the site’s visual design to match “Option A: Government style”: very serious, minimal, hard lines (reduce rounded corners), almost no color except a restrained accent, and remove any “AI-made” visual signals (no gradients, no glow effects, no playful/soft UI). Apply consistently across the header, hero, and all sections.

Refactor the Hero section styling to be government-grade: replace the background overlay gradient with a flat/near-flat overlay, remove the gradient headline treatment, and convert the rounded “pill” badge to a rectangular/squared badge. Keep all existing English marketing copy and both CTAs (Try the Demo and Contact Sales) and their behaviors/URLs unchanged.

Update section-level card and callout styling (e.g., Try Demo cards, Safety & Security cards/callouts, Contact cards) to remove “modern SaaS” embellishments (hover-heavy shadows, gradient icon containers, colorful multi-accent icons) and replace with government-style flat panels: light borders, minimal shadows, and consistent squared corners.

Update the header/navigation styling to match a government site: reduce translucency/backdrop blur effects, ensure strong contrast, use squared/low-radius hover/focus states, and keep navigation labels and demo link behavior unchanged.

Update the Try Demo section styling to remove the overly-green / AI-looking background treatment and replace it with a neutral, government-style background consistent with the site’s muted graphite/off-white palette (minimal use of green accent). Apply this specifically in `frontend/src/components/TryDemoSection.tsx` without changing any existing copy or the demo launch URL.

Rename the product/website branding from “SentinelAI” to “Nexus Forge AI” across all user-facing UI and metadata, while keeping the existing site structure, sections, and demo link behavior unchanged.
Add new Nexus Forge AI logo assets and update the header/footer to use the new logo files as static generated assets.

Implement a production-ready on-site AI assistant UI that allows visitors to ask questions and receive answers on the website (embedded widget or section), consistent with the government-grade design (flat panels, squared corners, minimal effects).
Wire the frontend assistant UI to the Motoko backend assistant API using the existing actor/auth setup patterns, with robust error handling and user-visible failure states.
Identify and fix the root cause of the deployment failure so the project can build and deploy successfully end-to-end.
Run and fix a complete frontend runtime smoke test of the single-page site: all sections render, navigation scroll targets work, and all external links open correctly without console errors.
Add a minimal backend health surface (non-breaking) to confirm the canister is deployed and callable, and wire a simple frontend check to display a clear failure state if the backend is unreachable.
Audit and fix any broken/missing static assets referenced by the UI (especially images under /assets/generated) so that all images load without 404s after deployment.

Make the on-site AI assistant visibly render on the website and work end-to-end with no runtime errors: add a dedicated assistant section/component to the single-page layout, ensure it is reachable/visible on initial page load, and ensure user questions can be submitted and answered with robust loading/error states.
Remove the on-page “Demo Environment” disclaimer block text from the Try Demo section so it no longer appears anywhere on the website.
Remove the “Text Analysis” demo prompt block from the Try Demo suggested prompts so it no longer appears on the page.
Remove the “Important Disclaimer” block and its disclaimer paragraph from the Safety & Security section so it no longer appears anywhere on the website.

Update the browser page title and social/SEO metadata in `frontend/index.html` to use “Nexus Forge AI” instead of “SentinelAI”. This includes the `<title>` tag and any `og:title` / `twitter:title` meta tags that currently mention “SentinelAI”.

Update the backend health surface in `backend/main.mo` so the frontend can reliably detect when the assistant API is actually usable (not merely that the canister responds), and use this to prevent the UI from attempting `getAnswer` calls when the backend is unavailable.

Improve frontend error handling for replica rejection errors (including IC0508 / reject code 5) so the Assistant section shows a clear, user-facing English message explaining the service is temporarily unavailable, and does not present raw replica/cbor/debug details to end users.
Run an end-to-end smoke test after changes to confirm the deployed backend canister is running and the Assistant section works end-to-end (submit question → receive answer) without runtime errors.

Remove all user-facing occurrences of the “SentinelAI” name from the website UI and replace them with “Nexus Forge AI”, ensuring that no visible text, aria-labels, alt text, headings, paragraphs, helper text, or CTA copy on any section renders “SentinelAI”. At minimum, update the known remaining occurrences in: `frontend/src/components/SiteHeader.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/SiteFooter.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/AssistantSection.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/UseCasesSection.tsx`, and `frontend/src/components/ContactSection.tsx`.

Update branding-related static asset references so the header/footer logo images and hero background no longer reference SentinelAI-named assets (e.g., `/assets/generated/sentinelai-...`) and ensure all referenced assets load without 404s after deployment.

Adjust Contact section copy and presentation so the website does not visually display the string “SentinelAI” anywhere, including the visible email address and auto-generated email subject/body text, while preserving the existing mailto destination behavior to the provided email address unless the user provides a replacement email.

Update the Assistant UI suggested questions in `frontend/src/components/AssistantSection.tsx` (the “Try asking:” buttons) so they reflect the expanded curated knowledge areas and reliably produce non-fallback answers with the updated backend knowledge base.

Fix the root cause of the backend reporting the assistant as not ready so `healthy()` returns `true` in normal deployed operation and the frontend does not show the red "Service Notice" banner or the "Assistant service is not ready" message when the assistant is actually usable.

Make the assistant Q&A flow work end-to-end in production: submitting a question from `frontend/src/components/AssistantSection.tsx` must successfully call the Motoko `getAnswer(question)` method and return an answer without replica rejection errors or traps.

Adjust frontend health and error handling so transient backend issues do not incorrectly stick the UI in a "not ready" state; ensure health is rechecked and the assistant becomes usable automatically when the backend becomes healthy again.
Run the documented assistant smoke test checklist and fix any failures so the deployed build passes all assistant health and Q&A checks without errors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a professional website explaining the AI app, its capabilities, how it works, and how companies can safely test it; include positioning for all company types and contact email.

Redesign the site to a government-style visual theme (very serious, minimal, hard lines, muted graphite/off-white with subtle green accent; no gradients/glow), to avoid an 'AI-made' look and feel suitable for real government clients.

Update the 'Try Demo' section background styling to remove the overly-green/AI-looking background; use a more neutral government-style treatment consistent with the muted graphite/off-white palette and restrained accent usage.
Rename the product/site to “Nexus Forge AI” and add an embedded AI assistant on the website that can answer visitor questions using real implemented logic (production-ready, no errors).

Implement the AI assistant’s answering logic as real backend functionality in Motoko (no placeholder responses), exposing a canister method that accepts a user question and returns an answer derived from a curated on-site knowledge base (site content/FAQs/capabilities/safe testing guidance).
Fix the on-site AI assistant so it visibly renders on the website and works reliably end-to-end with no runtime errors.
Remove the on-page 'Demo Environment' block (test environment disclaimer + text analysis prompt/example) and remove the 'Important Disclaimer' security disclaimer text from the website content.

Implement or repair the Motoko backend assistant API used by the website so the assistant can answer questions reliably, and ensure the frontend calls the correct canister method signature using the existing actor/auth setup pattern.

Implement a production-ready Motoko `getAnswer(question: Text) : async Text` in `backend/main.mo` that does not trap on mainnet and returns a deterministic, non-placeholder answer derived from an on-canister curated knowledge base (site FAQs/capabilities/how-it-works/safe testing guidance).

Fix the Motoko Assistant backend so the service reports ready/healthy and can answer questions reliably without trapping. Specifically: ensure `healthy()` returns `true` when the assistant knowledge base is usable, seed or persist a non-empty curated knowledge base on-canister, and change `getAnswer(question)` to never `trap` (including for unknown questions) and instead return a deterministic, user-friendly English fallback answer branded as “Nexus Forge AI”.

Improve the on-site assistant’s knowledge/answer coverage so it can accurately answer basic product questions (e.g., “What is Nexus Forge AI?”) using the site’s curated content, rather than returning a generic 'couldn’t find an answer' fallback.

Update the Motoko assistant knowledge base in `backend/main.mo` so it contains accurate, curated Q&A content derived from the website’s existing on-page copy (FAQ, How It Works, Safety & Security, Capabilities overview), including a correct answer for common product-intro questions such as “What is Nexus Forge AI?” and “What does Nexus Forge AI do?”. Remove or rewrite any backend Q&A entries that introduce claims not supported by the site’s content.

Fix and improve question matching in `backend/main.mo` so that user queries that are longer or phrased differently (e.g., “what is nexus forge ai or about it”, “tell me about nexus forge ai”, “what does nexus forge ai do”) still map to the best relevant curated answer instead of falling through to the “couldn’t find an answer” response.

Replace the current unknown-question fallback text returned by `getAnswer` in `backend/main.mo` with a more helpful, professional response that (1) states the assistant only answers based on the site’s published Nexus Forge AI information, (2) suggests several example topics/questions it can answer, and (3) avoids implying the user is at fault. Keep all user-facing text in English and branded as “Nexus Forge AI”.

Ensure `healthy()` in `backend/main.mo` reflects assistant readiness by returning `true` only when the curated knowledge base is available and non-empty (so the frontend does not attempt Q&A calls when the assistant content is missing).

Ensure the Motoko assistant canister always has a non-empty curated knowledge base at runtime (including after upgrades) so that `healthy()` is a reliable readiness signal and never reports "not ready" due to missing/empty knowledge data.
